markdown: Medical and Scientific Communications Plan 2000: Premarin® Family of Products ### III. Medical Congress Activity In its Year-in-Review annual analysis of trends affecting the pharmaceutical industry, health care consultant Scott-Levin highlights various industry trends. Using data from proprietary market research audits, strategic studies, and other sources, the report notes that in 1998 $1.3 billion was spent on promotional meetings and events, with a 28% increase over 1997. _Interactive Case Management Workshop_ DesignWrite proposes a series of satellite symposia at medical congresses that are including in the 1999-2000 Meeting Timeline (Table 1), each for a defined target audience. All the targeted specialties have the potential to incorporate the PREMARIN Family of Products into their care plans and to influence practitioners throughout the country to do so as well. Educational theory regarding how medical professionals learn has shown that physicians need targeted, repeated messages in order to incorporate new ideas and, most importantly, to put them into practice, both institutionally and in private practice. One of the best ways to reach medical professionals repeatedly is through continuing medical education (CME) programs: * Through attendance * Through providing published versions of the course material * Through additional follow-up material where appropriate The proposed symposia are designed to address important issues regarding management of the postmenopausal women in each professional medical organization. These symposia will be unique in that they will consist of interactive case management workshops. An interactive audience response system will be used to encourage participation, gather information, and build consensus among the health care professionals in attendance. This system has been shown to serve as an important learning aid and promotes retention of information and audience attention. ## Target Congresses The meetings and congresses identified in the timeline that could be targeted for 2000 include, but are not limited to, the following meetings: Primary Care/Family Practice AAFP (American Academy of Family Physicians) September 18-20, 2000 Dallas, TX 10 Jeffrey Solomon Exhibit SJ057 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/hjcw0217 DWRITE 066043 Page 10 of 33

### III. Medical Congress Activity In its Year-in-Review annual analysis of trends affecting the pharmaceutical industry, health care consultant Scott-Levin highlights various industry trends. Using data from proprietary market research audits, strategic studies, and other sources, the report notes that in 1998 $1.3 billion was spent on promotional meetings and events, with a 28% increase over 1997.

_Interactive Case Management Workshop_ DesignWrite proposes a series of satellite symposia at medical congresses that are including in the 1999-2000 Meeting Timeline (Table 1), each for a defined target audience. All the targeted specialties have the potential to incorporate the PREMARIN Family of Products into their care plans and to influence practitioners throughout the country to do so as well.

Educational theory regarding how medical professionals learn has shown that physicians need targeted, repeated messages in order to incorporate new ideas and, most importantly, to put them into practice, both institutionally and in private practice.

One of the best ways to reach medical professionals repeatedly is through continuing medical education (CME) programs: * Through attendance * Through providing published versions of the course material * Through additional follow-up material where appropriate

The proposed symposia are designed to address important issues regarding management of the postmenopausal women in each professional medical organization. These symposia will be unique in that they will consist of interactive case management workshops. An interactive audience response system will be used to encourage participation, gather information, and build consensus among the health care professionals in attendance. This system has been shown to serve as an important learning aid and promotes retention of information and audience attention.
## Target Congresses The meetings and congresses identified in the timeline that could be targeted for 2000 include, but are not limited to, the following meetings:
Primary Care/Family Practice AAFP (American Academy of Family Physicians) September 18-20, 2000 Dallas, TX
